intro: Ilysanthes anagallis, commonly known as the common wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along its stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or disturbed habitats. Ilysanthes anagallis is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for centuries in gardens.
